commit_message:
delete sg rule on sg deletion on ODL neutron northbound

When security group is deleted, rules belongs to that security groups are
automatically deleted by cascade=delete.
So rules need to be deleted explicitly when security group is deleted.
Otherwise stale rules remains.

Closes-Bug: #1663470
Change-Id: I44a07d27e44ef5ff17409163c3194cb47b1eede0
(cherry picked from commit c2d7228f1af99daf2b7e3bb6c4f13bb906e05344)

subject: Add horizon to ENABLED_SERVICES for related projs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-27 09:09:20.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Add horizon to ENABLED_SERVICES for related projs

General integrated gate tests that django_openstack_auth or manila-ui
run may not explicitly enable horizon, but these horizon-related
projects still need horizon added to ENABLED_SERVICES or they will not
be deployed at all[1]. Now that horizon was removed from the default
features matrix, we need to explicitly add it back for these projects.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/64/476064/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-django_openstack_auth-ubuntu-xenial/441cf8c/

Change-Id: Ic89f8b359e3a671153829b9cd4c28a3486e0c1fb
'}]
commit_message:
Add horizon to ENABLED_SERVICES for related projs

General integrated gate tests that django_openstack_auth or manila-ui
run may not explicitly enable horizon, but these horizon-related
projects still need horizon added to ENABLED_SERVICES or they will not
be deployed at all[1]. Now that horizon was removed from the default
features matrix, we need to explicitly add it back for these projects.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/64/476064/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-django_openstack_auth-ubuntu-xenial/441cf8c/

Change-Id: Ic89f8b359e3a671153829b9cd4c28a3486e0c1fb

commit_message:
Avoid double-encoding to bytes

Both the 'container_user' used within the 'cmd' variable and the
container path padding added to the 'out_file' variable in the
connection plugin should be strings since they're later encoded
to bytes by the inherited class.

Change-Id: I8874c439fc9c006125bb39ff6a2cd386bfc8f561

subject: Deprecate binary argument in nova service enable/disable/force-down CLIs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-27 23:21:37.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/v2/test_os_services.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/v2/legacy/test_os_services.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-service-binary-arg-2d5c446f5a2409a7.yaml', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate binary argument in nova service enable/disable/force-down CLIs

Change If1e03c9343b8cc9c34bd51c2b4d25acdb21131ff in the API in Pike
makes the os-services API look up services records via the host mapping
in the API datadabase to determine which cell the service lives in.
The host mappings only exist for nova-compute services, which means
you can only enable/disable/force-down nova-compute services now, which
is realistically the only service that ever made sense for those actions.

That change broke some functional tests in novaclient though which loop
through all services and disables them or forces them down. This change
fixes those tests by only attempting the action on nova-compute services.

This change also deprecates the binary argument to the service
enable/disable/force-down commands since the only value that ever really
worked or does anything is nova-compute, so a future version of the CLI
should just hard-code that value.

Change-Id: Idd0d2be960ca0ed59097c10c931da47a1a3e66fb
Closes-Bug: #1700359
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate binary argument in nova service enable/disable/force-down CLIs

Change If1e03c9343b8cc9c34bd51c2b4d25acdb21131ff in the API in Pike
makes the os-services API look up services records via the host mapping
in the API datadabase to determine which cell the service lives in.
The host mappings only exist for nova-compute services, which means
you can only enable/disable/force-down nova-compute services now, which
is realistically the only service that ever made sense for those actions.

That change broke some functional tests in novaclient though which loop
through all services and disables them or forces them down. This change
fixes those tests by only attempting the action on nova-compute services.

This change also deprecates the binary argument to the service
enable/disable/force-down commands since the only value that ever really
worked or does anything is nova-compute, so a future version of the CLI
should just hard-code that value.

Change-Id: Idd0d2be960ca0ed59097c10c931da47a1a3e66fb
Closes-Bug: #1700359

Change-Id: I8ed84d531971cbd7984f029abbebb373af4c7311

commit_message:
Logging: Disable debug logging by default

This PS disables debug logging for all services that had it on, and
removes the key from the default values.yaml. It does however ensure
that the mvp values has the appropriate key to make turning debugging
on simple.

Change-Id: I8ed84d531971cbd7984f029abbebb373af4c7311

subject: Cleanup duplicated methods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-22 12:28:03.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/servers.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup duplicated methods

Methods `get_vnc_console`, `get_rdp_console`, `get_serial_console` and
`get_spice_console` of ServersManager have complitely equal code, args spec
and docstrings for 2.0-2.5 and 2.6+ microversions. There is no reason to
duplicate those methods, so this patch removes duplicates.

Change-Id: I8c0e6f1f9138958bdb5d840cfd89e584c89895b0
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup duplicated methods

Methods `get_vnc_console`, `get_rdp_console`, `get_serial_console` and
`get_spice_console` of ServersManager have complitely equal code, args spec
and docstrings for 2.0-2.5 and 2.6+ microversions. There is no reason to
duplicate those methods, so this patch removes duplicates.

Change-Id: I8c0e6f1f9138958bdb5d840cfd89e584c89895b0

consumption and make flushing more robust for replication

commit_message:
Add possibility to configure tenant network types and type drivers

This patch add configuration options for tenant network types and type
drivers. Both lists are checked so that tenant types are listed in
drivers. For ironic 'flat' driver is mandatory and is added explicitly
into ironic prechecks.

Change-Id: Ie5775001165412910a258cbed2d2ebbb8ebbd879
Closes-Bug: #1694725

by testtool is assertEqual(expected, observed).

subject: [WIP] Allow setting specific ports for SRIOV handler
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-25 13:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/generic_vif.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/drivers/test_generic_vif.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/sriov_vif.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/handlers/test_sriov_vif.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Allow setting specific ports for SRIOV handler

Added possibility for SRIOV handler to parse pod annotations and
to get speciffic ports. If it is not specified then adresses are
requested from Neutron in specified subnet commonly. The total
amount of requested ports is equal to amount of requested
SRIOV VFs. Specific ports specified in pod annotations are not
deleted after deployment deleting.

Targets bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support

Change-Id: I72471fc7c9909152c9e17043fe9ee355ff1a812e
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Allow setting specific ports for SRIOV handler

Added possibility for SRIOV handler to parse pod annotations and
to get speciffic ports. If it is not specified then adresses are
requested from Neutron in specified subnet commonly. The total
amount of requested ports is equal to amount of requested
SRIOV VFs. Specific ports specified in pod annotations are not
deleted after deployment deleting.

Targets bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support

Change-Id: I72471fc7c9909152c9e17043fe9ee355ff1a812e

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-06-29 09:27:59.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/conf.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/network/test_networkutils.py', 'os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py'], 'message': 'Adds config option for caching WMI objects

networkutils currently caches WMI objects for performance reasons,
but it should be optional.

Adds cache_temporary_wmi_objects config option (default is True), which

'}]
commit_message:
Adds config option for caching WMI objects

networkutils currently caches WMI objects for performance reasons,
but it should be optional.

Adds cache_temporary_wmi_objects config option (default is True), which
enables or disables caching in networkutils.

Closes-Bug: #1693321

Change-Id: Id3aad3837d13a9c58c8a2898d594d412a42cd00c

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-29 09:15:32.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'message': "Retry changing VM state in case of exceptions

We're getting a considerable amount of transient errors when
attempting to change a VM state (e.g. when pausing it).

Since this operation is idempotent, it's safe to just attempt some
retries.

Change-Id: Ic24fd282c897594fb67a45124e31b374e4e2dd4b
Closes-Bug: #1694661
"}]
commit_message:
Retry changing VM state in case of exceptions

We're getting a considerable amount of transient errors when
attempting to change a VM state (e.g. when pausing it).

Since this operation is idempotent, it's safe to just attempt some
retries.

Change-Id: Ic24fd282c897594fb67a45124e31b374e4e2dd4b
Closes-Bug: #1694661

commit_message:
Fix tenant_quota_usages function calls caching

This patch changes type of 'targets' input parameter in
tenant_quota_usages function from list -> tuple. It provides
possibility for @memoized decorator to cache function calls.

Change-Id: I3c32c3b65ae91e8487fda6148f259fe1931d7c9f
Closes-Bug: #1700578

subject: doc: cleanup formatting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-29 09:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/topics/javascript_testing.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/testing.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/intro.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/run_tests.rst', 'horizon/tables/base.py', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/workflows.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/workflows.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/horizon.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/angularjs.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/tutorials/dashboard.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/contributing.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/tables.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/topics/packaging.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/forms.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/ref/tables.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/tutorials/table_actions.rst'], 'message': 'doc: cleanup formatting

* Clean up unnecessary vertical quotes at the left side
  caused by extra spaces at the beginning of lines.
* Do not use backquotes in the title lines
  (ref/run_tests.rst, ref/horizon.rst)
  When backquotes are used in the first-level title,
  it will be included in the navigation at the top-right corner
  https://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/contributor/ref/index.html
* Remove duplicated contents:: directive in ref/run_tests.sh.
  openstackdocstheme generates the toc by default, so having contents::
  directive leads to duplicated toc in a page.

Change-Id: Icc641927ad7cd7a8d79632c64a3ce212f0dc0b64
'}]
commit_message:
doc: cleanup formatting

* Clean up unnecessary vertical quotes at the left side
  caused by extra spaces at the beginning of lines.
* Do not use backquotes in the title lines
  (ref/run_tests.rst, ref/horizon.rst)
  When backquotes are used in the first-level title,
  it will be included in the navigation at the top-right corner
  https://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/contributor/ref/index.html
* Remove duplicated contents:: directive in ref/run_tests.sh.
  openstackdocstheme generates the toc by default, so having contents::
  directive leads to duplicated toc in a page.

Change-Id: Icc641927ad7cd7a8d79632c64a3ce212f0dc0b64

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-21 14:05:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py', 'openstack_dashboard/context_processors.py'], 'message': "test helper: Ensure to populate JS_CATALOG in context

_script_i18n.html which tries to access 'jsi18n' url assumes
context['JS_CATALOG'] is populated, but openstack_dashboard test
helper clears it by mocking a context processor.
This leads to a error in rendering templates in unit tests.
Note that template rendering error is caught by a rendering engine
so unit test itself succeeds even when this happens.

Change-Id: I0f5013c4e9ed7b166c527b1aacd0302413948d51
Closes-Bug: #1699509
"}]
commit_message:
test helper: Ensure to populate JS_CATALOG in context

_script_i18n.html which tries to access 'jsi18n' url assumes
context['JS_CATALOG'] is populated, but openstack_dashboard test
helper clears it by mocking a context processor.
This leads to a error in rendering templates in unit tests.
Note that template rendering error is caught by a rendering engine
so unit test itself succeeds even when this happens.

Change-Id: I0f5013c4e9ed7b166c527b1aacd0302413948d51
Closes-Bug: #1699509

commit_message:
Minimal support for storyboard

Allows setting of bug_project to a storyboard project number
to redirect to project page on storyboard.openstack.org for
report a bug feature.

Also, add some minor cleanups to doc/source/conf.py.

Change-Id: Ia14d30bf0dda89c48dec0a7cc3b8dccc26dc8d86

In Kernel 4.8 we introduced Traffic Control (TC see [1]) hardware offloads
framework for SR-IOV VFs which allows us to configure the NIC [2].
Subsequent OVS patches [3] allow us to use the TC framework
to offload OVS datapath rules.

This patch adds plug/unplug when using ovs vif 'OVS_ACCELERATION'. The
plug method will lookup the VF representor and connect it to 'br-int',
while the unplug method will remove the VF representor from 'br-int'.

[1] https://linux.die.net/man/8/tc
[2] http://netdevconf.org/1.2/papers/efraim-gerlitz-sriov-ovs-final.pdf

Change-Id: I90120119800cc2d3083b832700cc3d2ca655e638
"}]
commit_message:
hardware offload support for openvswitch

In Kernel 4.8 we introduced Traffic Control (TC see [1]) hardware offloads
framework for SR-IOV VFs which allows us to configure the NIC [2].
Subsequent OVS patches [3] allow us to use the TC framework
to offload OVS datapath rules.

This patch adds plug/unplug when using ovs vif 'OVS_ACCELERATION'. The
plug method will lookup the VF representor and connect it to 'br-int',
while the unplug method will remove the VF representor from 'br-int'.

[1] https://linux.die.net/man/8/tc
[2] http://netdevconf.org/1.2/papers/efraim-gerlitz-sriov-ovs-final.pdf
[3] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2017-April/330606.html

Change-Id: I90120119800cc2d3083b832700cc3d2ca655e638

commit_message:
Netronome SmartNIC Enablement

This is a proof-of-concept patch set illustrating the proposed changes
to enable Netronome SmartNIC acceleration in OpenStack. This is not
intended to be mergeable. Extra parameters and branches have been tagged
by the "Agilio" keyword to stand out, the intent is to replace that with
generic "SmartNIC" vendor-neutral code.

Change-Id: Iab36f185427d654af807254f2d3a5ba3632fc3b0
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

subject: Improve WMI job check method
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-28 19:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/test_jobutils.py', 'os_win/utils/jobutils.py', 'os_win/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Improve WMI job check method

At the moment, we're raising a HyperVException when a WMI job fails.
The issue is that this doesn't include the job status or error code
as attributes, which is troublesome when we need to have exception
handling logic relying on that.

This change adds a new exception that will include those fields,
also simplifying the WMI job status check method.

Note that although WMI jobs are not necessarily Hyper-V related,
we're inheriting HyperVException as that's what Nova expects at the
moment.

Also, we're now following the same logic as the HyperV PowerShell
module in terms of checking a WMI job state. States such as
"CompletedWithWarnings" (32768) will now be gracefully handled,
instead of throwing an exception.

Another thing to note is that we're now always treating the
'Exception' job state as a final state.

Partial-Bug: #1694661

Change-Id: I498281d3af673e4e6ac3adc2fb1a566efaba9d4e
'}]
commit_message:
Improve WMI job check method

At the moment, we're raising a HyperVException when a WMI job fails.
The issue is that this doesn't include the job status or error code
as attributes, which is troublesome when we need to have exception
handling logic relying on that.

This change adds a new exception that will include those fields,
also simplifying the WMI job status check method.

Note that although WMI jobs are not necessarily Hyper-V related,
we're inheriting HyperVException as that's what Nova expects at the
moment.

Also, we're now following the same logic as the HyperV PowerShell
module in terms of checking a WMI job state. States such as
"CompletedWithWarnings" (32768) will now be gracefully handled,
instead of throwing an exception.

Another thing to note is that we're now always treating the
'Exception' job state as a final state.

Partial-Bug: #1694661

Change-Id: I498281d3af673e4e6ac3adc2fb1a566efaba9d4e

commit_message:
Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions

Add support for the openSUSE Leap distributions. The security rules
are similar to the RedHat and Ubuntu ones. We also replace
ansible_os_family with ansible_pkg_mgr since the former does not
return consistent results across different SUSE distributions especially
on older Ansible versions.

commit_message:
Add gnocchi-statsd support for Debian systems

The current Docker container for gnocchi-statsd is missing support
for Ubuntu and will fail on start due to missing gnocchi-statsd
package.
Dockerfile extended by the required gnocchi-statsd package.

commit_message:
Restore vhostusersocket's default SELinux security contexts

Adds restorecon $vhostuser_socket_dir after the creation
of the directory, inorder to set the SELinux security contexts
for the same.

Closes-Bug: #1699975
Signed-off-by: Karthik S <ksundara@redhat.com>

when select Function/Metric/Comparator/Threshold, console pring error:
angular.js:13920 ReferenceError: expression is not defined
    at AlarmExpressionController.touch (directives.js:120)
    at directives.js:226
and the expression is not added.
Reason: lack of "var" before "expression" in the directives.js 226 file.

'}]
commit_message:
Fixed the Problem with add alarm expresion of Alarm Definition

when select Function/Metric/Comparator/Threshold, console pring error:
angular.js:13920 ReferenceError: expression is not defined
    at AlarmExpressionController.touch (directives.js:120)
    at directives.js:226
and the expression is not added.
Reason: lack of "var" before "expression" in the directives.js 226 file.
Closes-Bug:#1669647

Change-Id: I4079c961c0da71c41bbb0a9338b2bcf127fd281a

commit_message:
Avoid hanging endlessly on unreachable cache urls

When a download redirector redirects to a broken mirror, timeout
quickly rather than waiting until the overall job is being timed out.

subject: update unified publishing job to work for tags
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-28 19:13:33.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-publish-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'update unified publishing job to work for tags

The old version of the job converted the tag name to a branch and used
that as the publishing location. We do, however, want to be able to
publish docs for a given version of a deliverable when we tag it. That
will allow us to refer users directly to the guide for the version of
their tool or service.

This change assumes that the job is only configured in the release queue
and will not be run for pre-releases. If it sees that the trigger for
the job is a tag, it uses that as the output location. Otherwise it uses
the branch name. That gives us docs.openstack.org/$project/$version or
docs.openstack.org/$project/latest or
docs.openstack.org/$project/$series as the final destination of the
docs.

Change-Id: I5a3fe2775fc21c23fb1df6f6c987ec63000f1c7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update unified publishing job to work for tags

The old version of the job converted the tag name to a branch and used
that as the publishing location. We do, however, want to be able to
publish docs for a given version of a deliverable when we tag it. That
will allow us to refer users directly to the guide for the version of
their tool or service.

This change assumes that the job is only configured in the release queue
and will not be run for pre-releases. If it sees that the trigger for
the job is a tag, it uses that as the output location. Otherwise it uses
the branch name. That gives us docs.openstack.org/$project/$version or
docs.openstack.org/$project/latest or
docs.openstack.org/$project/$series as the final destination of the
docs.

Change-Id: I5a3fe2775fc21c23fb1df6f6c987ec63000f1c7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
SUSE: Add ability to use the upstream RabbitMQ package

The upstream project provides a rabbitmq package for SUSE so we default to
rabbitmq_install_method == 'file' like the rest of the distributions.
This also updates the rabbitmq test version to 3.6.9.

Change-Id: Iaf6918262e10b7b9129a86fa10090e34602b8f6f

subject: Trove user-delete API can use periods in user names in fact
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-18 07:23:53.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/user-management.inc'], 'message': 'Trove user-delete API can use periods in user names in fact

I can create and delete a user named "mytest.abc" correctly both
with mysql-5.6 and mongodb-3.0, not as the details describe that
"Do not use periods in user names".

In addition, in order to create a mongodb database user in trove,
its format must be as "DBName.UserName". And, I can delete the users correctly!

Closes-Bug: #1652889
Change-Id: I2316943475b0bcfdb498733e221d2021b8a827a0
'}]
commit_message:
Trove user-delete API can use periods in user names in fact

I can create and delete a user named "mytest.abc" correctly both
with mysql-5.6 and mongodb-3.0, not as the details describe that
"Do not use periods in user names".

In addition, in order to create a mongodb database user in trove,
its format must be as "DBName.UserName". And, I can delete the users correctly!

Closes-Bug: #1652889
Change-Id: I2316943475b0bcfdb498733e221d2021b8a827a0

commit_message:
Temporarily disable CRL use for haproxy

The CRL cron job that updates the CRL doesn't run as often as the
default expiry for the CRL file; it also isn't precise enough. So this
is being disabled fow now until that bit is reworked.

Change-Id: I2de9cb5c18bb108d3aa855d93e8bbfb89dcca052

commit_message:
Fix improper `next` and `previous` links in docs

Currently two pages inside contributor/ref/ section of horizon
doc has incorrect next and previous links. It shows text as well.

This is due to use of literal markup in rst title field. Removing
this fixes it.

One can see broken page at
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/contributor/ref/run_tests.html
and
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/contributor/ref/horizon.html

Change-Id: I8d450493ec847e85ec71500581c154ecd80df788
Closes-Bug: #1701134

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 6995, 'name': 'Sridar Kandaswamy', 'email': 'skandasw@yahoo.com', 'username': 'skandasw'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11171, 'name': 'Simon Murray', 'email': 'simon.murray@datacentred.co.uk', 'username': 'simonmurray'}, {'_account_id': 13702, 'name': 'yushiro', 'username': 'yushiro', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 16984, 'name': 'Nick Jones', 'email': 'nick@dischord.org', 'username': 'yankcrime'}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-07 11:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/drivers/linux/test_iptables_fwaas_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/drivers/linux/test_iptables_fwaas.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/linux/iptables_fwaas_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/linux/iptables_fwaas.py'], 'message': 'Improve iptables handling

The library routine diffutils.ndiff used to compare rulesets is O(N^2) complexity
which means as we increase the number of rules performance suffers exponentially
causing RPC timeouts, retries and essentially the L3 agent to not work.  This
alters the code for transforming neutron-fwaas rules into iptables so that the
comparison between rules works most of the time rather than never.  This prevents
the ndiff function from trying to unnecessarily discover differences between
individual lines which compunds the performance issue.

Change-Id: I55a24491e91d8a360696d7e2bf3d088a3336f85e
Partial-Bug: 1688573
'}]
commit_message:
Improve iptables handling

The library routine diffutils.ndiff used to compare rulesets is O(N^2) complexity
which means as we increase the number of rules performance suffers exponentially
causing RPC timeouts, retries and essentially the L3 agent to not work.  This
alters the code for transforming neutron-fwaas rules into iptables so that the
comparison between rules works most of the time rather than never.  This prevents
the ndiff function from trying to unnecessarily discover differences between
individual lines which compunds the performance issue.

Change-Id: I55a24491e91d8a360696d7e2bf3d088a3336f85e
Partial-Bug: 1688573

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-29 05:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'monascaclient/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I37090045a61a5c170cce0203aef20cfcbf70d022
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I37090045a61a5c170cce0203aef20cfcbf70d022

subject: Do not log stack traces when out of disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-28 09:43:04.000000000', 'files': ['notification.yaml', 'monasca_notification/main.py'], 'message': 'Do not log stack traces when out of disk

This commit silences monasca-notifications in situations where
it cannot write to its log file due to ENOSPC by preventing
the logging module from raising exceptions (recommended best
practice for production use).

The old behaviour can be restored by setting the
logging/raise_exceptions setting in the configuration file to
True (defaults to False).

Change-Id: Idbe5bdf56fb280412c34f04de8f2e2f301a7a432
Story: 2001089
Task: 4749
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log stack traces when out of disk

This commit silences monasca-notifications in situations where
it cannot write to its log file due to ENOSPC by preventing
the logging module from raising exceptions (recommended best
practice for production use).

The old behaviour can be restored by setting the
logging/raise_exceptions setting in the configuration file to
True (defaults to False).

Change-Id: Idbe5bdf56fb280412c34f04de8f2e2f301a7a432
Story: 2001089
Task: 4749

commit_message:
QuickStart guide changes

Quick start guide currently uses the deprecated Identity API.
The old and new APIs use different request and response structures.
With this change, the guide now uses the current(3.x) identity API
to get a token.

Additionally, this change updates the file to use the term "project"
in place of the older term "tenant".

Change-Id: I4357c769af4ffcca56556dba8b11540c57145774
Closes-Bug: #1681121

commit_message:
Migrate mistral task_type

In order to be able to get full info from the API for old tasks,
it is needed to get the type from the spec column to the type column.

The alternative was adding a release note explaining the inconsistency.

Change-Id: I48dd286f749ceb491ab32ee15af62a8db54acdc7
(cherry picked from commit 4f07468bc8e8fc4575ecbe260ae78d2ef8c19863)

commit_message:
Ingress controller for public endpoints

This PS provides the framework for Ingress controller based access to
public APIs.

Services covered:
 * Barbican
 * Cinder
 * Glance
 * Heat
 * Horizon
 * Keystone
 * Magnum
 * Mistral
 * Neutron
 * Nova
 * Senlin

Change-Id: I82d55f6ca41859ebed3312ec7d95b353df09e772
Implements: blueprint api-ingress
External-Tracking-Id: OSH-58, OSH-62

subject: Remove mistral from global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-28 20:44:02.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'openstack_requirements/tests/files/upper-constraints.txt', 'upper-constraints-xfails.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Remove mistral from global requirements

Historically, to write Mistral actions you would need to depend on
Mistral itself. However, with the introduction of mistral-lib this is no
longer required. The only consumer of mistral-as-a-library within
OpenStack was tripleo-common. It has been fully migrated to mistral-lib
(see depends-on) and the requirement can thus be removed.

Change-Id: I0a99c19d3cbcfbb396b09c008aff7a379a273d4c
Depends-On: I7ae2e0e4dbca6c02ed8ceedc066ca35eeb13c322
'}]
commit_message:
Remove mistral from global requirements

Historically, to write Mistral actions you would need to depend on
Mistral itself. However, with the introduction of mistral-lib this is no
longer required. The only consumer of mistral-as-a-library within
OpenStack was tripleo-common. It has been fully migrated to mistral-lib
(see depends-on) and the requirement can thus be removed.

Change-Id: I0a99c19d3cbcfbb396b09c008aff7a379a273d4c
Depends-On: I7ae2e0e4dbca6c02ed8ceedc066ca35eeb13c322

subject: Correct instructions about Nagios Wrapper in Plugins.md
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-06 02:14:06.000000000', 'files': ['docs/Plugins.md'], 'message': 'Correct instructions about Nagios Wrapper in Plugins.md

Should use 'name' but not 'service_name', beacuse each service
check must have a 'name' keyword. And the 'name' value is the name
of the metric not the 'service_name'.
The original gives an uncorrect example, will lead monasca-collector
complain errors like "ERROR collector monasca_agent.collector.checks.
check.nagios_wrapper Each service check must have a name...",
and this may confuse folks.

Change-Id: I2891b4d496184534da74cdfabf4e02570227b25d
Close-bugs:#1674593
Story: 2000969
Task:4120
'}]
commit_message:
Correct instructions about Nagios Wrapper in Plugins.md

Should use 'name' but not 'service_name', beacuse each service
check must have a 'name' keyword. And the 'name' value is the name
of the metric not the 'service_name'.
The original gives an uncorrect example, will lead monasca-collector
complain errors like "ERROR collector monasca_agent.collector.checks.
check.nagios_wrapper Each service check must have a name...",
and this may confuse folks.

Change-Id: I2891b4d496184534da74cdfabf4e02570227b25d
Close-bugs:#1674593
Story: 2000969
Task:4120

subject: Avoid FutureWarning of access_policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-11 09:40:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py'], 'message': "Avoid FutureWarning of access_policy

FutureWarnig message about access_policy:

    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py:200:
    FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
    value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.
    DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?', please update the code to
    explicitly set None as the value: access_policy defaults to
    LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private methods.
    Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
    ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.  access_policy)

Access_policy here is an optional argument, not a positional argument.

Change-Id: Ibd56cae4230fa1275002d1db1de4e68a08769eda
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid FutureWarning of access_policy

FutureWarnig message about access_policy:

    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py:200:
    FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
    value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.
    DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?', please update the code to
    explicitly set None as the value: access_policy defaults to
    LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private methods.
    Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
    ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.  access_policy)

Access_policy here is an optional argument, not a positional argument.

Change-Id: Ibd56cae4230fa1275002d1db1de4e68a08769eda

commit_message:
Correct RBAC Not Authorized status code

This patch corrects the RBAC "Not Authorized" status code to be 403
instead of 401.
It also switches some strings over to use constants.

commit_message:
Remove unused None from dict.get()

Since the default value is None when can't get a key from a dict,
So there is no need to use dict.get('key', None).

Clear them from Zaqar code tree.

Change-Id: I96d3438e13893bbe994f2f93cb8945a04e4d3ff9

subject: Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-29 09:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['cue/objects/utils.py'], 'message': "Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

The function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in
version '1.6' and will be removed in a future version.
We are using datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead[1].

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: Ia06770ee37df7729f8e3be2b0c097959b9bc8f44
Closes-Bug: #1527454
"}]
commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

The function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in
version '1.6' and will be removed in a future version.
We are using datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead[1].

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: Ia06770ee37df7729f8e3be2b0c097959b9bc8f44
Closes-Bug: #1527454

hashable, so that it can be used in sets.

Fix no attribute 'urlopen' error in python3

This commit fixes an error: "AttributeError: module 'urllib' has no
attribute 'urlopen'" with using six library. This is an incompatible
thing between python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I62ee7ee555708a2e948e6b812d996c3bb93cd6e8

subject: Improve debug logging from ring builder.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-28 22:09:13.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'swift/common/ring/utils.py'], 'message': "Improve debug logging from ring builder.

The gather/place debug logs used to just contain device IDs; now they

Change-Id: I6314e327973c57a34b88ebbb4d3b1594dbacd357

commit_message:
Improve debug logging from ring builder.

The gather/place debug logs used to just contain device IDs; now they
include region, zone, and IP. This makes it easier to see what's going
on when debugging rebalance operations.

Change-Id: I6314e327973c57a34b88ebbb4d3b1594dbacd357

Change default vagrant box to xenial64(16.04)

commit_message:
placement: refactor driver select_destinations()

Refactors the scheduler *driver* class select_destinations() method to
return a sorted list of HostState objects instead of a list of dicts.

This allows us to eventually use these HostState objects in our claim
logic in future patches.

Change-Id: I8f173fc36af249150e656f4a611c5ea6f2141ae3
blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

Change-Id: Iaca070a0ab9589fb25513eb5fad7d1e99974d572

commit_message:
Make developer debugging easier

This patch makes developer debugging of Octavia easier.  It adds
a configuration option that disables the controller worker taskflow
flows from reverting and cleaning up resources.
It also changes the amphora agent to keep a copy of a haproxy
configuration that failed validation.

Change-Id: Iaca070a0ab9589fb25513eb5fad7d1e99974d572

Centos/RHEL 7 doesn't support tgtd.  While the packages are still in

Switch cinder to use lioadm which uses LIO, and update package

commit_message:
Switch to lioadm for centos cinder

Centos/RHEL 7 doesn't support tgtd.  While the packages are still in
EPEL, there's no point in testing because nobody runs like this.
Switch cinder to use lioadm which uses LIO, and update package
installations.

Depends-On: I964917d13d9415223845ac17eb804ee7faceaf6f
Change-Id: Idc5a4e856bfc93e9dc650d565a98a8e9b3df3481

commit_message:
Freezerclient v2

Freezer client now has the ability to talk to v2 api endpoint

otherwise

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-06-26 15:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'restrict pep8 to files in repository

the pep8 test in tox.ini would run against *any files* located in
the work tree, including files which were not part of the repository.
This modifies the pep8 test so that it is will only check files
that have actually been committed to the repository.

Change-Id: If3106a29efe2f1b40625ac88b035c527badc595b
'}]
commit_message:
restrict pep8 to files in repository

the pep8 test in tox.ini would run against *any files* located in
the work tree, including files which were not part of the repository.
This modifies the pep8 test so that it is will only check files
that have actually been committed to the repository.

Change-Id: If3106a29efe2f1b40625ac88b035c527badc595b

commit_message:
Implement scenario006

Scenario006 will deploy COE on the overcloud, so we don't want to run
pingtest or tempest for now, just use a multinode job that will deploy
an undercloud and then an overcloud with k8s instead of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I3935849b48d349bb590d153340c37d58ad3e3148

commit_message:
Fix base post playbook

We don't need to collect logs, at the moment, as our existing jobs
are designed to collect them.

Also, since we need to log into the log server as jenkins, add that
to the ansible inventory information when we add the log server.

Change-Id: Ibbe39c14ccc63762e3b9eb376acc4615d942e8ad

cmd2 0.7.3 started to override Cmd.completenames with a function
taking additional parameters:

  Cmd2.completenames(self, text, line, begidx, endidx)

over the Cmd version:

  Cmd.completenames(self, text, *ignored)

With this change we adjust the override to the new signature.

Change-Id: I7b110502c20ec16c6032cce31021eee3f85255fc
Closes-Bug: #1700250

commit_message:
Adjust completenames tests for cmd2 0.7.3+

cmd2 0.7.3 started to override Cmd.completenames with a function
taking additional parameters:

  Cmd2.completenames(self, text, line, begidx, endidx)

over the Cmd version:

  Cmd.completenames(self, text, *ignored)

With this change we adjust the override to the new signature.

Change-Id: I7b110502c20ec16c6032cce31021eee3f85255fc
Closes-Bug: #1700250

This patch simplify the conditions
in servers.py (in nova api). The
description define was more complex until now here.
This patch transform the code, that the
description have a default value (name) and
if the api version request is supported, then
call the server_dict get method, which return
with server description. If this not defined,
then return with None, like before as this patch.

Change-Id: Ib74949972f23045f226613bd85d88cc6cd96d046
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify a condition

This patch simplify the conditions
in servers.py (in nova api). The
description define was more complex until now here.
This patch transform the code, that the
description have a default value (name) and
if the api version request is supported, then
call the server_dict get method, which return
with server description. If this not defined,
then return with None, like before as this patch.

Change-Id: Ib74949972f23045f226613bd85d88cc6cd96d046

commit_message:
Fix undefined basestring in py35

In py3 basestring is no longer valid, and should use `str` instead.
In order to cover py2 and py3, we change to use six.string_types.
Partial-Bug: #1682015

Change-Id: I2ba279241c64bcab93ecd9eb08081ce580c5f2e9

The `merge` option will basically copy all the files recursively inside
the container without removing the existing files or directory, while
the `preserve_properties` option keeps the file attributes
(permissions, ownership, timestamps) in the container.

This is useful if you have extracted some config files from a container

commit_message:
Introduce merge and preserve_properties for config_files

The `merge` option will basically copy all the files recursively inside
the container without removing the existing files or directory, while
the `preserve_properties` option keeps the file attributes
(permissions, ownership, timestamps) in the container.

This is useful if you have extracted some config files from a container
and want to use them in another container based on the same image.

This makes TripleO usage of Kolla much more robust.

Change-Id: I78dcec741a941dc21adba33ba33a6dc6ff1d217c

commit_message:
Clean up log messages

Comprehensive scrub of log messages for the following issues:

o Ensure 'instance=...' is in all messages where possible.
o Remove redundant references to instance within messages.
o Convert LOG.*(..., exception) to LOG.exception.
o Remove redundant exception text from LOG.exception usages.
o Minor reformatting to consolidate lines.

Change-Id: I0f385bc9e33a197eb3c86b3a13d97bbaac7cdd92

subject: grenade: Only 'enable_plugin ironic-inspector' if not already in conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-27 17:22:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/upgrade/settings'], 'message': "grenade: Only 'enable_plugin ironic-inspector' if not already in conf

To support multi-node grenade jobs we need to move enabling of the
ironic-inspector devstack plugin out of the ironic-inspector grenade
settings file devstack/upgrade/settings. But if we add enabling of the
ironic-inspector devstack plugin to project-config it will cause the gate
to break as the plugin will be enabled twice.

This patch is similar to the change done in ironic for the same purpose.

This checks to see if the ironic-inspector devstack plugin has already been
enabled:
  * If it has already been enabled it will not enable it again.
  * If it has not yet been enabled it will enable it.

This will allow us to update project-config to enable the ironic-inspector
devstack plugin and not break the gate.

After all the changes have landed we will propose a follow-up patch to
remove all this additonal logic and the enabling of the ironic-inspector
devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Id1a5de9a8aefe751b63c1a6a9f2c942fe4c957b1
Closes-Bug: #1672448
(cherry picked from commit 69157e5554ef6ad10f3d6d3ffc313d4e498ec21b)
"}]
commit_message:
grenade: Only 'enable_plugin ironic-inspector' if not already in conf

To support multi-node grenade jobs we need to move enabling of the
ironic-inspector devstack plugin out of the ironic-inspector grenade
settings file devstack/upgrade/settings. But if we add enabling of the
ironic-inspector devstack plugin to project-config it will cause the gate
to break as the plugin will be enabled twice.

This patch is similar to the change done in ironic for the same purpose.

This checks to see if the ironic-inspector devstack plugin has already been
enabled:
  * If it has already been enabled it will not enable it again.
  * If it has not yet been enabled it will enable it.

This will allow us to update project-config to enable the ironic-inspector
devstack plugin and not break the gate.

After all the changes have landed we will propose a follow-up patch to
remove all this additonal logic and the enabling of the ironic-inspector
devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Id1a5de9a8aefe751b63c1a6a9f2c942fe4c957b1
Closes-Bug: #1672448
(cherry picked from commit 69157e5554ef6ad10f3d6d3ffc313d4e498ec21b)

subject: Add a reset for traits DB sync
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-28 17:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Add a reset for traits DB sync

Some functional tests were failing, due to standard traits not being
found. The cause was that there is a flag that ensures that these
standard traits are only loaded once from the os_traits module to the
DB. The test fixtures, though, would clean up the DB between runs, and
the traits would never be re-loaded. This patch fixes that by directly
resetting this flag in the base test code.

Closes-bug: #1701035

Change-Id: I5dc0220310986c5b9fe5b71013c573c3d98cb9aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add a reset for traits DB sync

Some functional tests were failing, due to standard traits not being
found. The cause was that there is a flag that ensures that these
standard traits are only loaded once from the os_traits module to the
DB. The test fixtures, though, would clean up the DB between runs, and
the traits would never be re-loaded. This patch fixes that by directly
resetting this flag in the base test code.

Closes-bug: #1701035

Change-Id: I5dc0220310986c5b9fe5b71013c573c3d98cb9aa

subject: Copy kubeconfig to tempest dir
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-06-28 13:36:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Copy kubeconfig to tempest dir

In order to allow the tempest user from the upstream gate to load the
kubeconfig needed for the pod tests this script checks if there's such
home directory and if so it copies and mods the .kube/config file.

Otherwise, the tests fail as the .kube/config is written as stack user
in the gate at /opt/stack/new, which is the STACK_USER home.

Change-Id: Ibac0737c557aa1b6eef55d5681fd4c601cec4f09
Signed-off-by: Daniel Mellado <dmellado@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Copy kubeconfig to tempest dir

In order to allow the tempest user from the upstream gate to load the
kubeconfig needed for the pod tests this script checks if there's such
home directory and if so it copies and mods the .kube/config file.

Otherwise, the tests fail as the .kube/config is written as stack user
in the gate at /opt/stack/new, which is the STACK_USER home.

Change-Id: Ibac0737c557aa1b6eef55d5681fd4c601cec4f09
Signed-off-by: Daniel Mellado <dmellado@redhat.com>

subject: Replace vanity URL with the actual one
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-04-14 07:55:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/man/footer.rst'], 'message': 'Replace vanity URL with the actual one

Replace http://glance.openstack.org with
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/

The "vanity" URLs can be used currently, I am not sure they can
be used permanently, Since cinder, nova, glance...are all parts of
OpenStack, the resources of them are all parts of OpenStack,
So, using the uniform URL 'docs.openstack.org' is more reasonable.

Change-Id: Ieb6673af16f796d5db5c84023a9976a8f0a4e182
'}]
commit_message:
Replace vanity URL with the actual one

Replace http://glance.openstack.org with
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/

The "vanity" URLs can be used currently, I am not sure they can
be used permanently, Since cinder, nova, glance...are all parts of
OpenStack, the resources of them are all parts of OpenStack,
So, using the uniform URL 'docs.openstack.org' is more reasonable.

Change-Id: Ieb6673af16f796d5db5c84023a9976a8f0a4e182

commit_message:
Increase user_lockout_duration

Transient failures were being reported because the current lockout
period for users was too short. While this does increase the
run time of that specific test, it allows for more flexibility if
there is network latency or some other factor that cause the lockout
to expired before the next authentication.

Change-Id: If4544a91189b4473a6d36946e0857b5d3fa053d5
Closes-Bug: 1693917

subject: Add publication job for service-types-authority data
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-28 17:13:38.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/service-types.yaml'], 'message': 'Add publication job for service-types-authority data

Change the validate job to use the publish environment, since that
actually runs the full generation and local publication. Update
that to copy the generated files to the log server for examination,
both whatever is generated, and whatever publish thinks should be
published.

Add a job that publishes those results to the service-types directory on
static.openstack.org so that the service-types.openstack.org VHOST can
serve them.

Change-Id: I89e909f552afe967af9875799f599088957870cc
'}]
commit_message:
Add publication job for service-types-authority data

Change the validate job to use the publish environment, since that
actually runs the full generation and local publication. Update
that to copy the generated files to the log server for examination,
both whatever is generated, and whatever publish thinks should be
published.

Add a job that publishes those results to the service-types directory on
static.openstack.org so that the service-types.openstack.org VHOST can
serve them.

Change-Id: I89e909f552afe967af9875799f599088957870cc

subject: introduce plugin loading
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-12 18:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/plugins/directory.py', 'neutron_lib/plugins/loader.py'], 'message': 'introduce plugin loading

This patch introduces the notion of plugin loading including the ability
to populate a neutron_lib.plugins.directory. The functionality herein
is based off the plugin loading code in neutron.manager.NeutronManager.
However rather than rehoming the NeutronManager as-is this patch takes a
new modular approach given:
- The work done in [1] moves neutron's plugin "cache" to the directory
module in neutron_lib.
- The basic functionality of NeutronManager can be broken down into:
-- Loading the core plugin + services as well as the default and conf
specified service plugins and adding them all to the plugin directory.
This functionality is included herein.
-- Acting as a singleton structure to store pecan controllers/resources.
This functionality is not included herein and is left for future work
as the caching of pecan artifacts seems orthogonal.

The high level approach taken in this patch for plugin loading is:
- Provide a generic set of "loading" functionality including a generic
loader capable of loading plugins from a given conf and processing
pre/post validation. This functionality provides default capabilities to
load neutron core/default services/plugins as well as the ability to
load from non-default's in the future. See loader.py.
- Functionality in directory.py to use loaders to populate the directory
with plugins. Consumers can use these public functions to initialize
the plugin env.
- Use the service definitions introduced in [2] to determine default
services, lookup services for an api, etc.

[1] I7331e914234c5f0b7abe836604fdd7e4067551cf
[2] If9ccb0cf145aca4a7f051ce7c461b19936d3d25a

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-lib-networking-ovn

Change-Id: I263a56ed024455644d3be1fadad5900fe67f033a
'}]
commit_message:
introduce plugin loading

This patch introduces the notion of plugin loading including the ability
to populate a neutron_lib.plugins.directory. The functionality herein
is based off the plugin loading code in neutron.manager.NeutronManager.
However rather than rehoming the NeutronManager as-is this patch takes a
new modular approach given:
- The work done in [1] moves neutron's plugin "cache" to the directory
module in neutron_lib.
- The basic functionality of NeutronManager can be broken down into:
-- Loading the core plugin + services as well as the default and conf
specified service plugins and adding them all to the plugin directory.
This functionality is included herein.
-- Acting as a singleton structure to store pecan controllers/resources.
This functionality is not included herein and is left for future work
as the caching of pecan artifacts seems orthogonal.

The high level approach taken in this patch for plugin loading is:
- Provide a generic set of "loading" functionality including a generic
loader capable of loading plugins from a given conf and processing
pre/post validation. This functionality provides default capabilities to
load neutron core/default services/plugins as well as the ability to
load from non-default's in the future. See loader.py.
- Functionality in directory.py to use loaders to populate the directory
with plugins. Consumers can use these public functions to initialize
the plugin env.
- Use the service definitions introduced in [2] to determine default
services, lookup services for an api, etc.

[1] I7331e914234c5f0b7abe836604fdd7e4067551cf
[2] If9ccb0cf145aca4a7f051ce7c461b19936d3d25a

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-lib-networking-ovn

Change-Id: I263a56ed024455644d3be1fadad5900fe67f033a

commit_message:
Add check for quering neutron core resources with standardattr sort-key

This patch add the check in get_and_validate_sort_keys function. When user
query network/port or some other core resources which inherited from
HasStandardAttributes. And input sort-keys like created_at/description.
We can let them pass into following process.

Change-Id: Icfeab12b2317e3d186e0ce585a5de08b8d5b0bc7
Partial-Bug: #1659175

subject: Introduce service definitions
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-02 17:04:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/auto_allocate.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/flavors.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/l3.py', 'neutron_lib/api/definitions/base.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_segments.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_l3.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/metering.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_metering.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_auto_allocate.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/tag.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_loki.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_revisions.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/revisions.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/trunk.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/base.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_qos.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/network_ip_availability.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_network_ip_availability.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_trunk.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_tag.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_flavors.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/_dummy.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/loki.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/services/definitions/test_timestamp.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/qos.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/timestamp.py', 'neutron_lib/services/definitions/segments.py'], 'message': 'Introduce service definitions

Forward/motivation:
Today, metadata about neutron services (service plugins) is leveraged
in a number of ways by consumers. For example:
- Well known service type constants [2] are used by consumers
implementing and/or introspecting neutron service plugins. For
example LOADBALANCER [4].
- Interfacing with the EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING [5].
- Accessing service constants. For example QoS [6].

In addition, there maybe some areas for potential improvement in this
space including:
- More explicitly defining the default services that are today defined
in DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS [2].
- Explicitly linking a service definition to the API definitions it
supports.
- Leveraging some of the same techniques we did with neutron-lib API
defs that leverage the service metadata and define a base interface
so concrete service implementations don't have to implement this
common behavior.

This patch takes the first step in standardizing service definitions
that are static metadata about a particular service. It also
begins to provide a simple set of APIs across the definitions
including leveraging the linking between a service definition and
its respective api-def(s) supported.

Implementation details:
Neutron's notion of services (service plugins) includes not only the
backing code to implement extension(s), but also service specific static
metadata. For example:
- A plugin type and description as defined by the ServicePluginBase
interface [1].
- A collection of supported_extension_aliases [1] that define which
API extensions the service plugin implements. NB: these are now becoming
neutron_lib.api.definitions, so we can think of them as such in this
context.
- A stevedore entry-point name. While this is defined in setup.cfg of
neutron, the entry-point name is used in a number of cases in neutron.
For example in the DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS of neutron [2].
- A set of "default" service plugins [2]; DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS.
- A mapping from extension alias to service plugin type [2] via
EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING.
- A set of well known service types as defined as constants in [2].

This patch proposes we take an approach to defining that static aspects
of services in neutron-lib, similar to what we did in
neutron_lib.api.definitions for API extensions. By doing so we can
consolidate where services define this static data, and do away with
the global approach of managing EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING,
DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS, etc. in addition to the type and description
returned by the service plugin [1]. This approach also allows us to
build a simple set of APIs atop the service definitions that can be
used at runtime. For example when loading and binding plugin instances
to service definitions [3].

For an example of how these definitions map into neutron, please see
the neutron_lib.services.definitions._dummy module's comments.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/services/base.py#L52
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/common/constants.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/456343/1/neutron_lib/plugins/loader.py@48
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.LOADBALANCER
[5] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING
[6] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron%5C.services%5C.qos%20import%20qos_consts

Partially implements: neutron-lib-networking-ovn

Change-Id: If9ccb0cf145aca4a7f051ce7c461b19936d3d25a
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce service definitions

Forward/motivation:
Today, metadata about neutron services (service plugins) is leveraged
in a number of ways by consumers. For example:
- Well known service type constants [2] are used by consumers
implementing and/or introspecting neutron service plugins. For
example LOADBALANCER [4].
- Interfacing with the EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING [5].
- Accessing service constants. For example QoS [6].

In addition, there maybe some areas for potential improvement in this
space including:
- More explicitly defining the default services that are today defined
in DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS [2].
- Explicitly linking a service definition to the API definitions it
supports.
- Leveraging some of the same techniques we did with neutron-lib API
defs that leverage the service metadata and define a base interface
so concrete service implementations don't have to implement this
common behavior.

This patch takes the first step in standardizing service definitions
that are static metadata about a particular service. It also
begins to provide a simple set of APIs across the definitions
including leveraging the linking between a service definition and
its respective api-def(s) supported.

Implementation details:
Neutron's notion of services (service plugins) includes not only the
backing code to implement extension(s), but also service specific static
metadata. For example:
- A plugin type and description as defined by the ServicePluginBase
interface [1].
- A collection of supported_extension_aliases [1] that define which
API extensions the service plugin implements. NB: these are now becoming
neutron_lib.api.definitions, so we can think of them as such in this
context.
- A stevedore entry-point name. While this is defined in setup.cfg of
neutron, the entry-point name is used in a number of cases in neutron.
For example in the DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS of neutron [2].
- A set of "default" service plugins [2]; DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS.
- A mapping from extension alias to service plugin type [2] via
EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING.
- A set of well known service types as defined as constants in [2].

This patch proposes we take an approach to defining that static aspects
of services in neutron-lib, similar to what we did in
neutron_lib.api.definitions for API extensions. By doing so we can
consolidate where services define this static data, and do away with
the global approach of managing EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING,
DEFAULT_SERVICE_PLUGINS, etc. in addition to the type and description
returned by the service plugin [1]. This approach also allows us to
build a simple set of APIs atop the service definitions that can be
used at runtime. For example when loading and binding plugin instances
to service definitions [3].

For an example of how these definitions map into neutron, please see
the neutron_lib.services.definitions._dummy module's comments.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/services/base.py#L52
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/common/constants.py
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/456343/1/neutron_lib/plugins/loader.py@48
[4] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.LOADBALANCER
[5] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING
[6] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron%5C.services%5C.qos%20import%20qos_consts

Partially implements: neutron-lib-networking-ovn

Change-Id: If9ccb0cf145aca4a7f051ce7c461b19936d3d25a

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated 'message' attribute in Exception

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated and removed
from Python3.
For more details, please check:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: Ia304170faa6d3a6cec63b8f874101db7559176e5

commit_message:
Allow setting copied files group more precisely

Previously with the config_files structure of config.json, the group
name was automatically set to the one of the user name. It is now
possible to set the group name in the same fashion than the
'permissions' structure with:

  owner: 'desired_owner:desired_group'

Closes-Bug: #1696095
Change-Id: Ibae9f74e2351c81a717294467aedc51ea773c41e

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated 'message' attribute in Exception

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated and removed
from Python3.
For more details, please check:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: Ib3f142812c66354eadec3e5224f70f3ef8ce0e33

subject: nova/neutron format integration is failed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-20 12:44:13.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_notification_handler/test_neutron.py', 'designate/tests/test_notification_handler/test_nova.py', 'designate/notification_handler/neutron.py', 'designate/notification_handler/nova.py'], 'message': 'nova/neutron format integration is failed

Modify designate-sink formatv4/v6 parameter "project".
"tenant" key is not contain at "context" variable,
so I use "project_name" key.
And "context" dict object cannot use getattr function.

Change-Id: If485766a928bc2143b0b15afe99af38a6f927239
Closes-Bug: #1655581
(cherry picked from commit b23cae7b7839af2d2ed38c06a126f1e2a869ddd3)
'}]
commit_message:
nova/neutron format integration is failed

Modify designate-sink formatv4/v6 parameter "project".
"tenant" key is not contain at "context" variable,
so I use "project_name" key.
And "context" dict object cannot use getattr function.

Change-Id: If485766a928bc2143b0b15afe99af38a6f927239
Closes-Bug: #1655581
(cherry picked from commit b23cae7b7839af2d2ed38c06a126f1e2a869ddd3)

Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

commit_message:
Fix missing format of impl_infoblox config file

- The 'deprecated_reason' will created if 'deprecated_for_removal=True'
and help='DEPRECATED: <string>'.
- Currently format will be raising 'NoneType' object if we want
to genconfig testenv(in-progress [1]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/472770/

Change-Id: I1b542175cb471093787e0ba0947bc5920917f29b

commit_message:
Fix UUID and String value in test_pool

- Pool_id must be UUID value, it's not an integer.
- target_id must be UUID value [1].
- namserver_id must be UUID value [2].
- 'options' value of targets must be String format [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_target.py#L25
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_nameserver.py#L25
[3] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/objects/pool_target_option.py#L37

Change-Id: Ibd616470233747a7aab9fe04ebf5fcfa0a59fd22
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Improving check warning build_sphinx

- With this PS, we could be received a warning error at same time
when build sphinx decumentation of Designate via:

    $ python setup.py build_sphinx

- Fix some issues with docs sphinx.

Change-Id: I1e5a8c4b45dc3d10028531eabb50d3d6189ea070

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20936, 'name': 'Raoul Scarazzini', 'email': 'rasca@mmul.it', 'username': 'rasca'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-06-28 12:00:22.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/swift-proxy.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/disable-ceilo-middleware-6853cb92e3e08161.yaml'], 'message': "Disable swift middleware ceilometer pipeline by default

This generates tons of unnecessary events when gnocchi uses swift backend.
We end up filtering most of these anyway. So lets disable this so it
doesn't put useless load. Also changing the default project to service as
thats what gnocchi uses to authenticate with swift.

Closes-bug: #1693339

Change-Id: I40f47d46fdb06f31a739b590bf653bca71e33f61
"}]
commit_message:
Disable swift middleware ceilometer pipeline by default

This generates tons of unnecessary events when gnocchi uses swift backend.
We end up filtering most of these anyway. So lets disable this so it
doesn't put useless load. Also changing the default project to service as
thats what gnocchi uses to authenticate with swift.

Closes-bug: #1693339

Change-Id: I40f47d46fdb06f31a739b590bf653bca71e33f61

commit_message:
place holder environment config for toci and quickstart

Before environment config is formally used in toci, a
no-op place holder is required so toci does not run
with the default libvirt settings in [1].
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469992/

Change-Id: I25ed3361f8ffbef92adc44d9dd04906d9658641b

of plays.

commit_message:
Improve testcase

We should have better inputs for objects that we created
even when we don't face with wrong inputs because
we didn't call validate() for each time we set attribute.

- Fix some wrong UUID into correctly value.

Co-authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Ibe0e24e6cc0366deb2b669ade2c9ff87f7eebe4e

commit_message:
Remove .testrepository/times.dbm

When we run tox command, we are facing with
test fail problem like: "No module named gdbm".
This patch adds cleaning up of this file
before running next tests.

Change-Id: If906d8c684cce14b62dec718fd22b6903b0ac663

commit_message:
Ensure TTL is not 0 for zone imports

If zone imports have a ttl of 0 update
the zone ttl to the min_ttl configured for
the designate install

Change-Id: Idec854997fa9b6ad5d6af29bf6935c069dcbc40a
Closes-Bug: #1586178

'labs/osbash/scripts/config_private_network.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/install_memcached.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/osbash/wait_debug.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/osbash/enable_osbash_ssh_keys.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/apt_nosql_database.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/create_xxx_node_pxeboot.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_lbaas_network.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/ubuntu/setup_self-service_compute.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/etc_hosts.sh'], 'message': "Rework TOP_DIR logic

Currently, we use a simple logic for the client scripts to find
libraries, configuration files, etc. We know they will be copied to the
autostart directory from where TOP_DIR is one step up. If a user ever
tried to run a script in its original location (e.g. in scripts/ubuntu),
this logic would fail.

This has been a theoretical problem as long as users just used osbash.sh
or st.py to run the scripts. But if users would like to run extra
scripts, logging in to the nodes and running the scripts where they
find them would be the most natural way to do it.

Right now, the main use case is the heat service which is not installed
by default but can be installed at a later time if so desired -- with
the gotcha described above.

As more services are becoming optional add-ons to the install-guide,
this becomes an issue.

This patch installs a new logic: if a script finds a file named
TOP_DIR in its parent dir, it will use the file's contents as a
pointer to the TOP_DIR location.

TOP_DIR is a file rather than a symlink because the file needs to
work on Windows file systems as well.

The file lives in the parent directory rather than the script directory
because that reduces the number of such files that are required. This
becomes more relevant once we store additional services along with their
supporting files in extras/<service_name>/.

Change-Id: Ib0ccb108e5246ff8e06d87730ce11704d719fb75
"}]
commit_message:
Rework TOP_DIR logic

Currently, we use a simple logic for the client scripts to find
libraries, configuration files, etc. We know they will be copied to the
autostart directory from where TOP_DIR is one step up. If a user ever
tried to run a script in its original location (e.g. in scripts/ubuntu),
this logic would fail.

This has been a theoretical problem as long as users just used osbash.sh
or st.py to run the scripts. But if users would like to run extra
scripts, logging in to the nodes and running the scripts where they
find them would be the most natural way to do it.

Right now, the main use case is the heat service which is not installed
by default but can be installed at a later time if so desired -- with
the gotcha described above.

As more services are becoming optional add-ons to the install-guide,
this becomes an issue.

This patch installs a new logic: if a script finds a file named
TOP_DIR in its parent dir, it will use the file's contents as a
pointer to the TOP_DIR location.

TOP_DIR is a file rather than a symlink because the file needs to
work on Windows file systems as well.

The file lives in the parent directory rather than the script directory
because that reduces the number of such files that are required. This
becomes more relevant once we store additional services along with their
supporting files in extras/<service_name>/.

Change-Id: Ib0ccb108e5246ff8e06d87730ce11704d719fb75

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-21 18:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/index.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "fix the autodoc instructions

Use autodoc_index_modules instead of autodoc_tree_index_modules so only
one copy of the API docs are generated.

Exclude the tests subpackage because it's not part of the Glance Python
API.

Exclude the glance.db.sqlalchemy subpackage to avoid issues caused when
parts of it cannot be imported during the doc build because they rely on
alembic setting up values that are not configured for a simple import.

Change-Id: I127b812bc879fc39533b39df1785d93835142430
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix the autodoc instructions

Use autodoc_index_modules instead of autodoc_tree_index_modules so only
one copy of the API docs are generated.

Exclude the tests subpackage because it's not part of the Glance Python
API.

Exclude the glance.db.sqlalchemy subpackage to avoid issues caused when
parts of it cannot be imported during the doc build because they rely on
alembic setting up values that are not configured for a simple import.

Change-Id: I127b812bc879fc39533b39df1785d93835142430
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
rearrange existing documentation to follow the new layout standard

This change moves existing files, updates a few of the cross-references
and paths, and fixes some formatting. It is not meant to be the final
word on how the main page looks or how the other files are organized,
but it gets everything roughly into shape. If the glance team wants to
make changes, please do those as follow-up patches

This change depends on the spec and on a feature of pbr that allows us
to move where the auto-generated class reference documentation ends up
in the tree.

Depends-On: Ia750cb049c0f53a234ea70ce1f2bbbb7a2aa9454
Depends-On: I2bd5652bb59cbd9c939931ba2e7db1b37d2b30bb
Change-Id: I9dde267793a5913acb5b1ec028cfb66bc5189783
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
tasks: tempest_install: Simplify distro package installation

Use the 'package' Ansible module to simplify the distribution
package installation instead of having separate playbooks per package
manager. Moreover, avoid the loop by passing the package list directly
to the module

Change-Id: Ie3e3e8bec057ee07acacc8733a1984fbe168b7cd

commit_message:
Add manager resource

This patch adds the Manager/ManagerCollection resource. Manager
resource will provide information about remote access controls like
serial console, command shell, graphical console etc. It will also
serve as the gateway to virtual media, ethernet interfaces (NICs)
information.
'ResetActionField' moved to a new file, "resources/common.py",
to be reused both by system and manager resource. Necessary changes
are also made to the usage documentation page pertaining to Manager
resource.

Partial-Bug: #1673886
Change-Id: I1d1b9b3f13002e654e4dc62d0558f5a2afbd8662

subject: Remove telemetry roles from role requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-27 15:26:51.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-telemetry-0e90e3fcdc26b9d1.yaml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Remove telemetry roles from role requirements

The telemetry roles are under-maintained, and not properly tested.
Hence, the roles are removed as a requirement  from OpenStack-Ansible
until they can find a maintainer.

The telemetry code(tasks, variables, etc.) will be kept in the
integrated repo.

Change-Id: I0de73859608e0c4538b17429878b177e7276b095
'}]
commit_message:
Remove telemetry roles from role requirements

The telemetry roles are under-maintained, and not properly tested.
Hence, the roles are removed as a requirement  from OpenStack-Ansible
until they can find a maintainer.

The telemetry code(tasks, variables, etc.) will be kept in the
integrated repo.

Change-Id: I0de73859608e0c4538b17429878b177e7276b095

commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'

In tempest, alias 'manager' has been moved to 'os_primary'
in version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens.
This patch is to replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'.

For other details, please check [1] and [2]
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463484/

Change-Id: Ie2ed78ed2b382a83d9ad2adcade864358037ae5e

commit_message:
[upstream] Move Branching Model to Archive

It was intended that this be moved to the archive since we
haven't used it in the latest training. We cover some discussion
of stable branches elsewhere so it's not necessary to have a whole
